Package game.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
game.model.Board
public class Board extends Object
Board for the BoxAndDot game.

      public boolean isField(int index)
      Given the index, check if that index is valid in the field.
      Parameters:
      index - the index we want to check
      Returns:
      True if it is a valid field; otherwise False.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      True if that field has been filled.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Tests if the whole board is full.
      Returns:
      true if all fields are occupied

    • hasSquare

      public boolean hasSquare(int index)
      Given an index, check if the player is able to form a square at that index. If it is able, then set that field to the current player's mark (which means, that particular box belongs to that player)
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the field
      Returns:
      True if there is a square that has been formed; otherwise false

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Returns true if the game is over. The game is over when there is a winner or the whole board is full.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over

    • isDraw

      public boolean isDraw()
      Check if the game is draw or not.
      Returns:
      True if game is draw; otherwise False

    • isWinner

      public boolean isWinner(Mark m)
      Checks if the mark m has won. A mark wins if it controls at least one row, column or diagonal.
      Parameters:
      m - the mark of interest
      Returns:
      true if the mark has won

    • hasWinner

      public boolean hasWinner()
      Check if there is a winner at the end of the game.
      Returns:
      true if there is a winner (either A or B); otherwise false.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a String representation of this board. In addition to the current situation, the String also shows the numbering of the fields.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the game situation as String

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Empties all fields of this board (i.e., let them refer to the value Mark. EMPTY).

    • setField

      public void setField(int i, Mark m)
      Given the index, set the content of field i to the mark m.
      Parameters:
      i - the field number
      m - the mark to be placed

    • setField

      public void setField(int row, int col, Mark m)
      Sets the content of the field represented by the (row,col) pair to the mark m.
      Parameters:
      row - the field's row
      col - the field's column
      m - the mark to be placed
